clinical_study.brief_title: Neoadjuvant Bevacizumab + Chemotherapy Combined With Short-course Radiotherapy
clinical_study.official_title: Efficacy and Safety of Neoadjuvant Bevacizumab + Chemotherapy Combined With Short-course Radiotherapy for RAS Mutant-type Locally Advanced Rectal Cancer

brief_summary.textblock: Prospectively Investigate the effectiveness and safety of neoadjuvant Bevacizumab + chemotherapy (mFOLFOX6) combined with short-course radiotherapy (25Gy/5Fx) for RAS mutant-type locally advanced rectal cancer

primary_outcome.time_frame: From the start of treatment to 3 months after surgery
primary_outcome.description: Complications occurring in the perioperative period

secondary_outcome.description: Refers to the pathological examination of primary tumors and lymph node surgical specimens without residual infiltrating tumor cells (ypT0N0, TRG 0)

Refers to the probability of not finding local recurrence of tumor within 2 years，including anastomotic recurrence confirmed by pathological biopsy, pelvic tumor recurrence confirmed by imaging examination, or suspected pelvic recurrence with CEA exceeding the normal upper limit.
Refers to the probability of no distant metastasis within 2 years
Refers to the time from the start of treatment to death due to any cause.

intervention.description: Bevacizumab 5mg/kg d1 Oxaliplatin 85mg/m2 d1 Calcium Folinate 400mg/m2 d1 5-fluorouridine 400mg/m2 d1 5-fluorouridine 2400mg/m2 46h q2w, 6 cycles
